SECTION_CONTENT:
PLUTONIUM NITRATE:
CARCINOGEN STATUS – None as a chemical. However, exposure to ionizing radiation may
cause cancer and plutonium may be carcinogenic when internally deposited.
ACUTE TOXICITY LEVEL - No data available.
TARGET EFFECTS - Plutonium in the body most often accumulates in the lungs, lymph nodes,
liver and skeleton. Lesser, yet significant quantities may also be found in the gonads, spleen, and
